result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Jacques was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.  Absolute sobriety at all times of alcohol and controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  No contact with C.S. or T.S.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. Jacques in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requesting plea and sentencing 45 days out for employment purposes and jail start date.  Attorney ORourke gives reasoning.  Matter is resolved.  State request to proceed today. Court takes plea today.  Set sentencing out.  943.20(1)(a) amended by State.   State gives further recommendation  30 months probation, 6 months Sauk Co Jail, $518.00 costs (DNA included) treatment and conditions.  Attorney ORourke agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Attorney ORourke request to proceed to sentencing.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
30 months Probation
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
Absolute sobriety at all times of alcohol and controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  
No contact with C.S. or T.S.
6 months Sauk County jail with work release.  No good time.  Jail to commence on or before October 1, 2014 at 7 p.m.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)  Cash bond to apply
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant David A. Jacques in court with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Defendant David A. Jacques in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.

Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Return date on April 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant David A. Jacques appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State request $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions.  Advised rights to an attorney. Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  No warrants.  Ties to the community.  Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with C.S. & T.S. or Dairy Queen, Sauk Prarie.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
